item.title: Advancing Viscerally Unhuman Technology
item.description: A few days ago, a friend asked the following: I’ve recently been wondering about the politics of unnatural technology. Like, what is the history of normalizing advancements that people find viscerally inhumane? Current technology in this bucket is pro-natal tech, BCI, cultivated meat, etc. Let me know if you have any thoughts or recommendations on what to read. item.title: A Tale of Two Shoulders
item.description: About a year and a half ago, skiing through the Colorado backcountry, I tripped on a stray branch and suffered one of the most excruciating injuries of my life: an anterior shoulder dislocation. Ski patrol tried, and failed, to reduce it on the slopes. After an hour of snowmobiles, vans, and gritted teeth, an ER doctor finally slid my shoulder back in place. Around the same time, my cousin, same age, height, build, and activity level, dislocated his shoulder while playing basketball in Greece.
